channel.title: Mini ITX Build
channel.description:
Case: Compucase 8K07 : £45 Motherboard: Gigabyte GA-GC330UD or Asus AT3N7A-I : £63/£100 RAM: 1GB 667mhz DDR2: £15 give or take HDD: 500 GB Western Digital £35
Total: £158(or £195 if I get the Asus mobo)
I won't be needing a cd drive or anything like that, and the case comes with a 120W PSU which should be enough for all that. Thoughts?

item.title: Mini ITX Build
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:21, topic:319448”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=415914.msg3074739#msg3074739 date=1261748437]

http://img695.imageshack.us/img695/5984/pc220145.jpg

Easiest build ever, unscrew hdd/optical tray, put mobo in, harddrive on, ram, connect all the wires and tada!

Why is that SATA cable/port yellow?

  • more pics pls.
    [/quote]

If you ever built a decent computer, its because GIGABYTE always uses this except on their newer motherboards with the blue theme.[/quote]
Because only Gigabyte makes decent motherboards, right?

Read full topic

item.title: Mini ITX Build
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:18, topic:319448”][quote author=Niall link=topic=415914.msg3074034#msg3074034 date=1261691383]
http://img695.imageshack.us/img695/5984/pc220145.jpg

Easiest build ever, unscrew hdd/optical tray, put mobo in, harddrive on, ram, connect all the wires and tada!
[/quote]

Why is that SATA cable/port yellow?

  • more pics pls.[/quote]

Because orange is sexy. You know you want it.

http://img706.imageshack.us/img706/3897/pc220146.jpg

From another angle and I’ll take a pic of it next to my antec 900 later tonight.

The PSU is louder than I expected, but even with CPU fan around 6000rpm the harddrive reading/writing is still louder.

Read full topic

item.title: Mini ITX Build
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:9, topic:319448”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=415914.msg3059662#msg3059662 date=1260750509]
Cool stuff. What do you plan on using it for? Would make a decent server box.
[/quote]

Because of the low power usage I’m probably just going to use it for downloading/uploading and maybe something else, but I only get 768kbits upload so I can’t really do a lot with it.[/quote]
yeha the VM 20mbit package sucks for uploading, go to 50mbit you get 1.5mbit upstream then

Read full topic

item.title: Mini ITX Build
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

skip the case, get some cheap cabinet with rails from ikea or somewhere and buy a couple of motherboards. you could cut down on the ram significantly (128-256MB/node). enjoy your budget cluster

edit: oh right, power supply. nevermind

Read full topic

item.description:

Because of the low power usage I’m probably just going to use it for downloading/uploading and maybe something else, [B] but I only get 768kbits upload so I can’t really do a lot with it.[/quote]

item.description:

[quote=“Niall, post:5, topic:319448”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=415914.msg3059644#msg3059644 date=1260749829]
Where is the CPU?
[/quote]

Intel Atom 330 is integrated on both motherboards(1.6GHZ dual core).[/quote]

Which at 100% Load, puts out about 80W.
My assumption of 120W not being enough was a bit off per say.

item.description:

None-The-Less, the only veto I have, is 1GB of RAM, at least 2 or nada.
